snippet: Senator Chuck Schumer was criticized for opposing a reduction in a federal grant program that pays for counterterrorism efforts in New York.
abstract: White House Press Sec Josh Earnest criticizes Sen Chuck Schumer of New York for complaining about cut in New York City's share of federal Urban Area Security Initiative, from $600 million to $330 million, which helps support local counterterrorism efforts; Earnst indicates that reason behind drastic cut is that city has not yet fully used previously allocated counterterrorism funds.
lead_paragraph: Senator Chuck Schumer was criticized for opposing a reduction in a federal grant program that pays for counterterrorism efforts in New York.

headline.main: White House Chides Schumer for Protest of Counterterrorism Cuts
headline.print_headline: White House Strikes Back at Schumer for Protesting Counterterrorism Cuts
